{"step_by_step_thinking": "Based on the information provided in the documents, mutations in the SOD1 gene have been identified in approximately 20% of familial ALS cases and in a small percentage of sporadic ALS cases. Therefore, the answer is yes, Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS) can be associated with a mutation of the Super Oxide Dismutase 1 (SOD) gene.", "answer_choice": "A"}
